children.subject:
Spring 2018 was Math 53, Chem 1B, Phys 7A, E7 with a club and research

Fall 2018 was MSE 45, MSE 45L, ME C85, Data 8, Phys 7B, with 2 clubs and research

Spring 2019 is R1B, Phys 7C, CS 61A, Data 100, MSE 111, with 1 club

None of these semesters have been walks in the park, but I've gotten through them reasonably well as far as GPA and workload are concerned. Worst case scenario, I can always take it easier if need be, but I still would like recommendations as to which of the 2 options I should pursue

Nice! Seems like you can handle taking lots of techs. My best guess is option B is better, mainly because 110 + 127 + 140 are all pset classes, so I think having 2 project courses, two pset courses would could be a nice combo to have.
Thanks! Do you have anything to say with regard to choice of professors, or do you think it doesn't make a major difference either way?
I can only comment on classes I've taken and profs I had: hug + 61B is great, Adhikari + 140 is great, 189 + Shewchuk is great.
I think picking good professors is decently important
All option schedules look very hard. Have you taken 4 techs in the past? Which ones? How did it go? Each class you've listed is MUCH harder than any of the previous ones you took in my opinion.

I don't do data science/ML stuff, but I have taken 188, 110, and of course 61B; I would say they should all be substantially lighter in terms of workload than 127 and 189 (can't comment on the others). 110 reteaches a lot of material in 54 but from a theoretical/high-level proof-based standpoint, which is indeed what makes it so valuable; however, the material itself you've already seen. Also, the semester I took it homework was optional. 188 projects are something similar to implementing pseudocode, and if you understand the derivations of the algorithms you are being taught you'll be fine on exams. Therefore, I'd recommend option A to have a slightly more even workload across the two semesters; I'm not certain if 188 is strictly useful as a prerequisite for 189 anyway, while 127 material certainly will be.

Both options have one semester that will be worse than others, but I'm leaning towards option B because your fall classes are pretty foundational, and you want to have those concepts down really well.

127 + 189 in the spring with Shewchuk will be good (you can read more of my opinion taking both those in @8968 @8893) , but those are the only two techs I'm taking at the moment (plus a bunch of extra curriculars) so not sure how pleasant it will be with 2 other techs (coming from someone who has taken 3-4 techs in a few semesters).

history.content:
For context, I'm a sophomore planning on working in industry in data science after graduation. I've taken/am taking Math 53, Math 54, E7, Data 8, Data 100, and CS 61A. Currently, my class schedule for the next two semesters will be either

 Option A

Fall 2019Spring 2020
CS 61BINFO 159
Math 110CS 188
Prob 140CS 182
EECS 127

CS 189

 

or 

Option B

Fall 2019Spring 2020
CS 61BINFO 159
Math 110EECS 127
Prob 140CS 182
CS 188

CS 189

Any advice on which option I should go with, and why? If it's relevant, 188 is being taught by Anca Dragan in the Fall and Sergey Levine in Spring, while EECS 127 is being taught by Alexandre Bayen in the Fall and Laurent El Ghaoui and Gineerja Ranade in the Spring.

I know neither of these options is easy, but any advice (especially with your reasoning so I can understand your perspective) would be appreciated 

Note: Also I know 189 is a recommended prereq for 182, but Prof DeNero said that Data 100 has enough machine learning as far as 182 is concerned 

Thanks!
history.subject: Should I take CS 188 or EECS 127 next semester (+ General Schedule Advice)
